request.description:
Refreshes the page and reinjects all necessary files. This may be useful for when trying to save memory
This will attempt to re register all listeners EXCEPT onLiveLocation and onParticipantChanged
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#refresh)

request.description:
Adds label from chat, message or contact. Only for business accounts.
Parameter: label: either the id or the name of the label. id will be something simple like anhy nnumber from 1-10, name is the label of the label if that makes sense.
Parameter: id The Chat, message or contact id to which you want to add a label
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#addlabel)

Parameter: id The Chat, message or contact id to which you want to add a label

request.description:
Send VCARD

Parameter: {string} chatId '000000000000@c.us'
Parameter: {string} vcard vcard as a string
Parameter: {string} contactName The display name for the contact. CANNOT BE NULL OTHERWISE IT WILL SEND SOME RANDOM CONTACT FROM YOUR ADDRESS BOOK.
Parameter: {string} contactNumber If supplied, this will be injected into the vcard (VERSION 3 ONLY FROM VCARDJS) with the WA id to make it show up with the correct buttons on WA. The format of this param should be including country code, without any other formating. e.g:
`4477777777777`
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#sendvcard)

originalRequest.description:
Send VCARD

Parameter: {string} chatId '000000000000@c.us'
Parameter: {string} vcard vcard as a string
Parameter: {string} contactName The display name for the contact. CANNOT BE NULL OTHERWISE IT WILL SEND SOME RANDOM CONTACT FROM YOUR ADDRESS BOOK.
Parameter: {string} contactNumber If supplied, this will be injected into the vcard (VERSION 3 ONLY FROM VCARDJS) with the WA id to make it show up with the correct buttons on WA. The format of this param should be including country code, without any other formating. e.g:
`4477777777777`
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#sendvcard)

request.description:

request.description:
Sets the chat state
Parameter: {ChatState|0|1|2} chatState The state you want to set for the chat. Can be TYPING (0), RECRDING (1) or PAUSED (2).
Parameter: {String} chatId
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#setchatstate)

request.description:
This is a convinient method to click the `Use Here` button in the WA web session.

Use this when [[STATE]] is `CONFLICT`. You can read more about managing state here:

[[Detecting Logouts]]
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#forcerefocus)

Use this when [[STATE]] is `CONFLICT`. You can read more about managing state here:

[[Detecting Logouts]]
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#forcerefocus)

request.description:
A list of participants in the chat who have their live location on. If the chat does not exist, or the chat does not have any contacts actively sharing their live locations, it will return false. If it's a chat with a single contact, there will be only 1 value in the array if the contact has their livelocation on.
Please note. This should only be called once every 30 or so seconds. This forces the phone to grab the latest live location data for the number. This can be used in conjunction with onLiveLocation (this will trigger onLiveLocation).
Parameter: chatId string Id of the chat you want to force the phone to get the livelocation data for.
@returns Promise<LiveLocationChangedEvent > | boolean
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#forceupdatelivelocation)

originalRequest.description:
A list of participants in the chat who have their live location on. If the chat does not exist, or the chat does not have any contacts actively sharing their live locations, it will return false. If it's a chat with a single contact, there will be only 1 value in the array if the contact has their livelocation on.
Please note. This should only be called once every 30 or so seconds. This forces the phone to grab the latest live location data for the number. This can be used in conjunction with onLiveLocation (this will trigger onLiveLocation).
Parameter: chatId string Id of the chat you want to force the phone to get the livelocation data for.
@returns Promise<LiveLocationChangedEvent > | boolean
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#forceupdatelivelocation)

request.description:
Sends a text message to given chat
If you need to send a message to new numbers please see [these instructions:](https://docs.openwa.dev/pages/The%20Client/licensed-features.html#sending-messages-to-non-contact-numbers)
Parameter: to chat id: `xxxxx@c.us`
Parameter: content text message
[External Documentation](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#sendtext)
